title: Binaries go1.1.windows-386.msi >>and<< go1.1.windows-386.zip crash on-the-fly on Windows 2000
body:
by **jasaugusto**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since the
latest release. =>> Checked, and didn't found any similar.

Search the issue tracker and check that you're running the
latest version of Go. =>> It is Go 1.1, fresh version, installation done with
binary go1.1.windows-386.msi and also with archive go1.1.windows-386.zip. Failure in
both.

The crash dump is shown in one of the attached pictures.

Comments: 

1) Windows 2000 with all updates done (until discontinued, of course ;-)

2) Go 1.0.3 was running perfectly

3) The "offending directory" is in picture Go1.1Crash.png.        
C:/Users/ADMINI~1/AppData/Local/Temp/2/bindist664137607/go/src/cmd/go/ve
t.go:37 +0x4b
but C:\Users doesn't exist in my machine (see picture Go1.1CrashCDir.png)

4) Uninstalling the .msi and unzipping the go1.1.windows-386.zip archive gives
>>exactly<< the same output. So it seems not to be a problem from the
installer.

5) Processor is an old AMD (see picture Go1.1CrashSysInfo.png)

6) What steps will reproduce the problem? =>> Really not enough info to suggest
something... Some other Windows 2000 box perhaps (I have another W2K box, in another
place, I'll try to reproduce in a couple of days)

7) I'll try to compile the sources with mingw (I have the 4.6.2 toolchain installed) and
report ASAP.
Attachments: 1. Go1.1Crash.png (11134 bytes) 1. Go1.1CrashCDir.png (3139 bytes) 1. Go1.1CrashSysInfo.png (5236 bytes)
